short_summary: Reconstruction of a granular wilderness trail and construction of bridges and boardwalks.
description: The following is a detailed description of the project:",
full_summary:
**Title**
Stage 1 - Boreal Trail, Bridges and Boardwalk Construction, Riding Mountain National Park

**Reference Number**
5P468-23-0125/A

**Procurement Category**
Construction Services

**Solicitation Description**
Parks Canada invites qualified bidders to submit a bid for the construction of the Boreal Trail, Bridges, and Boardwalk in Riding Mountain National Park. The scope of work includes the reconstruction of a granular wilderness trail, construction and installation of a 145-meter boardwalk with a gathering node, and construction and installation of two pedestrian bridges over Jackfish Creek, each spanning 12 meters. The successful bidder will be responsible for the removal and adjustment of existing wood piles, clearing and grubbing of vegetation, rough grading, rip rap installation, granular trail and seating area construction, construction of low gabion basket retaining walls, and restoration seeding for areas disturbed by the work.

**Tender Details**
* **Solicitation Method**: Competitive – Open Bidding
* **Contract Type**: Design-Build
* **Contract Duration**: From August 22, 2023, to March 31, 2024
* **Estimated Value**: $1,000,001 to $5,000,000, inclusive of taxes

**Submission Instructions**
Bids submitted via fax or email will be accepted as official. Bidders are required to submit their bid through the Government of Canada's electronic tendering system (GC Tendering). It is the bidder's responsibility to ensure that their bid is received by the designated contact person by 4:00 PM Eastern Daylight Time (EDT) on July 25, 2023.

**Correspondence and Enquiries**
All correspondence and enquiries related to this solicitation must be submitted in writing and sent to the designated contact person:
Ken Lacanilao
Senior Contracting Officer
Parks Canada
kenneth.lacanilao@pc.gc.ca
(587) 832-1894


**Documents and Attachments**
The tender documents and any additional information related to this solicitation can be obtained from the Government of Canada's tendering service website at [www.canadabuys.canada.ca](http://www.canadabuys.canada.ca).
